text: bursting with plump pink shrimp and
bright yellow lemons this pasta dish is
wonderful to welcome in spring now
you'll want to start with a pound of
shrimp buy them with the head on and the
shells because we're gonna use those to
make a richly flavored stock for our
pasta that comes together very quickly
now if you can't find them with the
heads on it's a-okay peel the shells off
including the tail and then have the
shrimp lengthwise using a paring knife
okay
we're ready to start cooking start by
melting a tablespoon of unsalted butter
in a skillet over medium heat and then
we add our shrimp shells and a
tablespoon of tomato paste what this
will do is it will caramelize and add a
nice flavor to the dish this will take
only about two minutes until the shells
are vibrant pink and opaque and as you
can see here the tomato paste is
creating a fond on the bottom of the pot
and that's all flavor okay this is ready
for our wine use a good dry white wine
you'll need about a quarter cup I'm
gonna eyeball it this is gonna deglaze
that beautiful fond off the bottom of
the pan and I'm gonna crank the heat on
this now because I want this wine to
evaporate almost completely that would
cook all of that alcohol off before we
add the water
okay this gets a quart of water that's
four cups let this come to a boil over
high heat and then reduce the heat and
simmer for about thirty minutes our
shrimp shells and water and tomato paste
have reduced down to a luscious stock
so now we can strain it we should have
about two and a quarter cups of stock
here when all is said and done this goes
back onto a medium flame more butter two
tablespoons let the butter melt and then
in goes one minced shallot it's about a
quarter to a third of a cup depending on
the size of your shallot and to this for
a little bit of heat some red pepper
flakes 1/2 teaspoon and while this
begins to cook let's get our pasta going
have a large pot of water to a rolling
boil and it's very important to
generously salt your pasta water it'll
impart a lot of flavor into the dish
this is muffled DNA but as you can see
the
I just have a nice ridging I like the
way they mimic the shrimp when they cook
so it makes for a beautiful presentation
this is a pound that goes in here your
boiling water now the shallots have
sweat nicely so we can add our shrimp
season them first generously with salt
these just need to turn opaque and then
they can be turned that'll happen in
just a few minutes it's very fast so
don't go anywhere a good general rule
for any time you're cooking pasta is to
go at least two minutes less than the
package instructions this pastas gonna
finish cooking in the pan with the
shrimp I can see that these are turning
a pea cup the sides of the shrimp so
they're ready for a turn if they've ever
cooked they become tough so it's really
key here to just get them cooked through
our pasta is looking pretty close I
think it's time to add the lemon slices
this is from half a lemon so that'll be
four or five slices the lemon slices
just add a gentle citrus note to the
pasta dish okay these have turned to pay
ik and they're pink throughout so now we
can add wine another quarter cup into
the pan let this come to a boil be sure
that alcohol is cooked out of that wine
before you add the shrimp stock
otherwise you're gonna have that taste
of alcohol in goes the stock let this
simmer and reduce for just about two
minutes that's all it really needs and
do not let it boil whatever you do
boiling it will certainly make your
shrimp tough and overcooked our pasta is
ready to come out of the water and our
shrimp is ready just in time for creme
fraiche in goes a quarter cup of the
creme fraiche you could certainly use
sour cream if you don't have creme
fraiche quick stir the pasta including
those lemon slices goes right into the
pan and the pasta is going to finish
cooking in the pan just give this a turn
just until the pasta is evenly coated
and the sauce thickens slightly remove
it from the heat as it sits off the heat
the pasta will continue to absorb that
sauce and now we're ready for the
finishing touch before we bring to the
table transfer the pasta to a beautiful
serving dish like this one squeeze of
lemon from the
half of the lemon we didn't use yet and
more red pepper flakes and there you
have it muffled DNA with shrimp and
lemon happy eating
